question: Question_01_(a)
sols:
To evaluate this integral, we integrate by parts.

Let

\begin{align*}
u &=\ln(x) \quad \Rightarrow \quad du = \frac{1}{x}dx \\
dv &= x\,dx \quad \Rightarrow \quad v = \frac{x^2}{2}.
\end{align*} Substituting these into the integral, we get

\begin{align*}
\int u\,dv &= uv - \int v\,du
\\ \int x\ln(x)\,dx &= \ln(x)\cdot\left(\frac{x^2}{2}\right)-\int \frac{x^2}{2}\frac{1}{x}dx
\\&= \frac{1}{2}x^2 \ln(x) - \frac{1}{2}\int x\,dx
\\&= \frac{1}{2}x^2 \ln(x) - \frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{x^2}{2}\right) + C
\\ {\color{blue}\int x\ln(x)\,dx}&\, {\color{blue}= \frac{1}{2}x^2 \ln(x) - \frac{1}{4}x^2 + C}\end{align*}
